segments.text:
The standard way to compute this is similar to the coin change problem, where each palindromic number is a "coin" that can be used any number of times. So for each palindrome i, we iterate through all j >=i and add dp[j -i] to dp[j]. So the code should have:

dp[j] = (dp[j] + dp[j -i]) % MOD

where MOD is 1e9+7. But in the code provided, the outer loop is for i from 1 to 40000. For each i, if it's a palindrome, then for j from i to 40000, the code needs to do the update.
segments.label: high_level_plan

dp[j] %= 10**9+7
